菅氏、日本酒には「大変可能性がある」…輸出拡大支援へ具体策

04 Nov 2019, 10:56



日本酒の輸出に取り組む酒造会社の店舗を視察する菅官房長官（鳥取県境港市で）

　菅官房長官は４日、鳥取県境港市で、日本酒などの輸出に取り組む酒造会社の店舗を視察し、日本酒の海外輸出拡大に向けた支援を強化する方針を表明した。具体策として〈１〉外国向けの新商品開発の支援〈２〉海外のバイヤーの日本への招請〈３〉農産品の知的財産権を規定する「地理的表示」の活用――を進める意向を示した。
　菅氏は記者団に、「農産品輸出の一環として日本酒は大変可能性があり、高付加価値化とそれに応じた価格設定、ブランド戦略が必要だ」と指摘した。菅氏は酒が飲めないが、この日は少量を口にした。
　日本酒の輸出額は、２０１８年は対前年比１９％増の約２２２億円で、９年連続で増えている。輸出先のトップは米国で、次いで香港、中国、韓国の順だった。
　政府は、１９年に農林水産物・食品の輸出額を１兆円とする目標を掲げており、海外で人気の高い日本酒を柱の一つに育てたい考えだ。国税庁は９月に、「日本酒のグローバルなブランド戦略に関する検討会」（座長・小泉武夫東京農業大名誉教授）を設置し、日本酒のブランド戦略や海外輸出振興策について議論を本格化させている。

Mr. Tsuji, sake has “very potential” ... concrete measures to support export expansion

04 Nov 2019, 10:56



Secretary of the Secretary of the Secretary of Staff (in Sakaiminato City, Tottori Prefecture)

房 Secretary of the Secretary of Secretary inspected a store of a sake brewery company engaged in the export of sake, etc. in Sakaiminato City, Tottori Prefecture, and announced a policy to strengthen support for expanding the export of sake. As specific measures, (1) support for new product development for foreign countries, (2) invitation of overseas buyers to Japan, and (3) use of “geographical labeling” that regulates the intellectual property rights of agricultural products showed that.
菅 Mr. Tsuji pointed out to the reporters that “Sake is very possible as part of the export of agricultural products, and high value-added, price setting and brand strategy are necessary.” Mr. Tatsumi cannot drink, but on that day he ate a small amount.
Sake exports increased 19% year on year to approximately 22.2 billion yen, increasing for the ninth consecutive year. The top export destination was the United States, followed by Hong Kong, China, and South Korea.
The government has set a goal of 1 trillion yen in the export value of agriculture, forestry and fishery products and food in 1919, and wants to cultivate sake that is popular overseas as one of its pillars. In September, the NTA established the “Study Group on Global Brand Strategy for Sake” (Chairman: Takeo Koizumi, Professor Emeritus, Tokyo University of Agriculture), which is in earnest to discuss the brand strategy of sake and overseas export promotion measures.
